name: Modify/delete iptables firewall rules
description:
Instead of completely "disabling" iptables, adversaries may choose to delete a certain rule, which, for example, blocks data exfiltration via ftp.
By doing so, they may cause less noise to avoid detection.

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if iptables is installed on the machine.

data.command:
if [ ! -x "$(command -v iptables)" ]; then echo -e "
***** iptables NOT installed *****
"; exit 1; fi
if ! echo "$(iptables -L)" | grep -q "DROP .*dpt:ftp"; then echo -e "
***** this firewall rule is NOT activated *****
***** activate it by executing "iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 21 -j DROP" *****
"; exit 1; fi
